title: The Middle Ground
description: Witty, neurotically, endearingly - Kate Armstrong is that age—along with the crisis, accompanying it. With a career as a successful journalist, specializing in feminist issues, she struggles to challenge herself at work. She’s a mother, of an empty nest children, her marriage has ended in divorce. She done have friends, but her relationships with them are complicated by years bad history , drama, failed affairs. Leaving one stage of life behind with another ahead of her. Right now she’s stuck somewhere in the middle, a woman alone in London for the first time in years—slowly rediscovering herself in a city in a time of change... Retro Margaret Drabble early work...
author: Margaret Drabble
